001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Pair;
006
007import java.util.List;
008
009/**
010 * Represents a loss function that operates at the sample level,
011 * i.e., over an entire set of estimated versus target values rather
012 * than a single dimension.
013 *
014 * <p>
015 * A {@code SampleLossFunction} coordinates multiple
016 * {@link DimensionLossFunction} implementations to calculate the overall
017 * sample loss and per-dimension gradients. This is typically used in
018 * machine learning contexts where a sample consists of multiple features
019 * or output dimensions.
020 */
021@DomainObject
022@Strategy(role = Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
023public interface SampleLossFunction extends LossFunction {
024
025    /**
026     * Calculates the total loss for a sample by applying the corresponding
027     * {@link DimensionLossFunction} to each element of the estimated and
028     * target arrays.
029     *
030     * @param sample        a pair containing the estimated values (left)
031     *                      and target values (right) for a single sample
032     * @param lossFunctions the list of dimension-specific loss functions
033     *                      to be applied
034     * @return the total loss for the sample as a {@code float}
035     */
036    float calculateSampleLoss(Pair<float[], float[]> sample, List<DimensionLossFunction> lossFunctions);
037
038    /**
039     * Determines the gradient of the loss function for each dimension of
040     * the sample, given the estimated and target arrays.
041     *
042     * @param estimated     the predicted values for the sample
043     * @param target        the expected target values for the sample
044     * @param lossFunctions the list of dimension-specific loss functions
045     *                      to be applied
046     * @return an array of gradient values, one per dimension
047     */
048    float[] determineGradients(float[] estimated, float[] target, List<DimensionLossFunction> lossFunctions);
049
050    /**
051     * Retrieves the appropriate {@link DimensionLossFunction} for a given
052     * index. If the index exceeds the number of available loss functions,
053     * it is wrapped around using modulo arithmetic.
054     *
055     * <p>
056     * This provides a convenient way to cycle through loss functions
057     * when the number of dimensions exceeds the number of functions.
058     * </p>
059     *
060     * @param lossFunctions the list of dimension-specific loss functions
061     * @param index         the index of the dimension
062     * @return the corresponding {@link DimensionLossFunction}
063     */
064    default DimensionLossFunction get(List<DimensionLossFunction> lossFunctions, int index) {
065        return lossFunctions.get(index % lossFunctions.size());
066    }
067}
